member.name: ISyncMgrEnumItems.Clone
member.summary: Creates another items enumerator with the same state as the current enumerator to iterate over the same list. This method makes it possible to record a point in the enumeration sequence in order to return to that point at a later time.
member.param: The address of a variable that receives the interface pointer.
member.returns: Return S_OK if the method succeeds.

member.name: ISyncMgrEnumItems.Next
member.summary: Enumerates the next celt elements in the enumerator's list, returning them in rgelt along with the actual number of enumerated elements in pceltFetched.
member.param: The number of items in the array.
The address of array containing items.
The address of variable containing actual number of items.
member.returns: Return S_OK if the method succeeds.

member.name: ISyncMgrEnumItems.Reset
member.summary: Instructs the enumerator to position itself at the beginning of the list of elements.
member.returns: Return S_OK if the method succeeds.

member.name: ISyncMgrEnumItems.Skip
member.summary: Instructs the enumerator to skip the next celt elements in the enumeration so that the next call to does not return those elements.
member.param: The number of items to skip.
member.returns: Return S_OK if the method succeeds.

member.name: ISyncMgrEnumItems
member.summary: Exposes methods that enumerate through an array of structures. Each of these structures provides information about an item that can be synchronized. ISyncMgrEnumItems has the same methods as all standard enumerator interfaces: Next, Skip, Reset, and Clone.
